vulnerabilities.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: Use of weak cryptographic algorithm MD5. Use SHA-256 or stronger.

vulnerabilities.title: Hard-coded Password
vulnerabilities.description: Direct password comparison. Store passwords securely, never hard-code them.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive data stored without encryption. Encrypt at rest and in transit.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: Hard-coded password comparison. Implement proper authentication mechanisms.

vulnerabilities.title: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Potential command injection using os.system. User input should never be passed directly to system commands.

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Potential SQL injection detected near execute() call with f-string.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description: Potential XSS vulnerability. User input should be properly escaped.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
return f"

Search results for: {query}

" # XSS vulnerability

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal
vulnerabilities.description: Potential path traversal vulnerability. File paths should be validated.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: with open(f'/tmp/{filename}', 'w') as f:  # Path traversal

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal
vulnerabilities.description: Potential path traversal vulnerability. File paths should be validated.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: with open(f'/tmp/{filename}', 'w') as f:  # Path traversal

vulnerabilities.title: Unrestricted File Upload
vulnerabilities.description: File upload without type validation. Restrict file types to whitelist only.

vulnerabilities.title: Unrestricted File Upload
vulnerabilities.description: File upload without type validation. Restrict file types to whitelist only.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: Critical operation with unvalidated input. Always validate and sanitize user input before use.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: POST endpoint without CSRF protection. Implement CSRF tokens for state-changing operations.

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before sql injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
cursor = conn.cursor()
    query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}"
    cursor.execute(query)  # SQL injection vulnerability
    return jsonify(cursor.fetchone())

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before command injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-78: Command Injection
    cmd = request.args.get('cmd')
    os.system(cmd)  # Command injection
    return 'Command executed'

vulnerabilities.title: Inter-procedural Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Dangerous function get_user is called and may execute user input.

vulnerabilities.title: Inter-procedural Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Dangerous function run_command is called and may execute user input.

vulnerabilities.title: Debug Mode Enabled
vulnerabilities.description: Flask debug mode enables the interactive debugger, allowing arbitrary code execution.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing HTTPS Configuration
vulnerabilities.description: Application runs without SSL/TLS configuration.

vulnerabilities.title: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Potential command injection using eval. User input should never be passed directly to system commands.

vulnerabilities.title: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Potential command injection using subprocess.call. User input should never be passed directly to system commands.

vulnerabilities.title: Code Injection via eval
vulnerabilities.description: Dangerous eval() usage detected. User input may be executed as code.

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: Hardcoded secret detected. Store credentials in environment variables.

vulnerabilities.title: Unsafe Deserialization
vulnerabilities.description: Unsafe deserialization of untrusted data. Use safe alternatives like JSON.

vulnerabilities.title: Hard-coded Cryptographic Key
vulnerabilities.description: Hard-coded secret detected. Use environment variables or key management.

vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: POST endpoint without CSRF protection. Implement CSRF tokens for state-changing operations.

vulnerabilities.title: Weak JWT Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: Using weak JWT algorithm (HS256 or none). Use RS256 or stronger algorithms.

vulnerabilities.title: Unsafe Deserialization
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before unsafe deserialization.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-502: Unsafe Deserialization
    data = request.get_data()
    obj = pickle.loads(data)  # Deserialization vulnerability
    return jsonify({'result': str(obj)})

vulnerabilities.title: Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before code injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-95: Code Injection
    code = request.args.get('code')
    result = eval(code)  # Code injection
    return jsonify({'result': result})

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before command injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-78: Command Injection
    service = request.args.get('service')
    subprocess.call([service])  # Command injection
    return 'Service started'
